page.title: 01Pewsey Vale Western End
page.content: The majority of the block lies in a plain bouned on the north by hills. The soil is a heavy loam with a subsoilof chalk and clay. It is a well cultivated and used mainly for growing grain but it does support some cattle, sheep and horses. The area is sparsely populated and very rural with around seven farms, the largest of which houses the well known Tanhill herd of pedigree Limousin cattle. The Kennet and Avon canal runs east to west and provides a leisure area for fishing and boating. Houses range from the very old thatch-roofed type to modern brichk-built buildings. Farmwork is the main employment but some people travel further afield for work. A normal amount of retired people remain in or move to the area because of the relative calm and pastoral nature of the surroundings,
